intro: Rhodocalyx cinereus, commonly known as the ash-colored rhodocalyx, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from pale blue to white. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small oval leaflets. Rhodocalyx cinereus is typically found in woodland and thicket habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
